intro: Artemisia kruhsiana subsp. alaskana, commonly known as Alaska wormwood, is a perennial herb native to the northern regions of North America. It is characterized by its aromatic, silver-gray foliage and small, yellowish-green flower clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as tundra and rocky slopes. It has a taproot system and is adapted to cold climates with short growing seasons. Its essential oils contribute to its distinctive scent and have been used in traditional herbal medicine.
